data.title: Beyond Good & Evil 20th Anniversary Edition launches June 25 for every system (sans mobile)
data.meta_description: Swoop into the marvelous world of Hillys as action-reporter Jade to investigate the mysterious DomZ alien attacks alongside colorful characters, like her...
data.text:
ILikeFeet

Fox Brigade

Jun 20, 2024

#1

Swoop into the marvelous world of Hillys as action-reporter Jade to investigate the mysterious DomZ alien attacks alongside colorful characters, like her adoptive uncle Pey’j or the valiant Double H.

Embark on this epic adventure in up to 4K, 60 frames per second with improved graphics, controls, and audio, along with brand-new autosave and cross-save features.

Enjoy exclusive new rewards as you explore the planet and discover more about Jade’s past in a new treasure hunt throughout Hillys.

Put your skills to the test thanks to the new speedrun mode and updated achievements, and learn more about the game’s development and secrets in the anniversary gallery!

Armed with her dai-jo and faithful camera, Jade’s adventure will get you to freely explore Hillys, combat creatures large and small, infiltrate dangerous areas, solve enigmatic puzzles, play addictive mini-games, race the best hovercraft pilots, and take pictures of the whole experience.

Be ready to dive into a trailblazing blend of action gameplay and thrilling emotional cutscenes!

Beyond Good & Evil 20th Anniversary Edition launches June 25 for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC

Beyond Good & Evil 20th Anniversary Edition will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC on June 25, Ubisoft announced.

Last edited: Jun 20, 2024

This is a very good game, and if you haven't played it, I encourage you to do so. This only makes me more angry at the follow-ups. Every attempt to make a sequel has gone reboot/prequel direction, when a decent chunk of what makes the game special is Jade/Pey'j and the backstory. The thing that would bring me to a sequel is more of that story

Jun 24, 2024

#31

The games out here in Aus now! Got it for Switch. I only just finished the intro and haven't grabbed her camera yet so my knowledge is limited on how the rest of the game looks or performs. It tries to hit *30 but can dip sometimes, during gameplay I noticed zero dips but only during a camera pan in a cutscene it did. It seems to hit 720p in handheld with some form of aliasing to help fend off most jagged edges. Texture quality seems mixed, in some places it makes me wonder if they're worse than the GC original. But overall it uses all the new lighting and models they've shown off so far so I'm liking the way it's all presented here, seems like a great port so far!

Edit: *Initially I mentioned it hit 60fps but I guess that was my tired eyes from last night misinterpreting it! It does appear to be 30, sorry for misleading anyone.

Last edited: Jun 24, 2024
